ELEMENT.TITLE: Avalanche

ELEMENT.DEFAULT:
• The tier 1 categories are listed horizontally and there is a finite amount of space allocated. If more text/links are present than what will 'fit', the aesthetic of the theme will break. This is not a bug, it was designed with the intent of having 1 single row of categories listed horizontally. Use shorter category names or have fewer visible categories if this occurs.
  • The tier 2 and focus tier 3 categories will display on the left when the left column is present. If your specialty store has a root cat three levels deep, this feature will not work properly.

ELEMENT.HTML:
<%
/* the subcategories listed on the left show tier 2 and, when appropriate, tier 3 for the tier 2 in focus. */
/* specialty stores get handled slightly differently to take into account their root level categories are typically tier 2. */
/* gets run on H and E pages to 'reset' the menu (will set to blank). on C pages, it actually sets the vars. */

print("");

/* the only way to get the individual categories is to put the entire category path into a stack and then to retrieve the content of spot 1, 2 and/or 3 */
loadurp("SREF::_CWPATH");
	pull(stack=>>$PATHSTACK,format=>"textlist",delimiter=>".",p1=>"TIER1",p2=>"TIER2",p3=>"TIER3");
	pop(stack=>>$PATHSTACK,namespace=>"PATH");

/* check the rootcat to see if it is anything other than .   If a specialty store is in focus, the rootcat will be longer. */
	loadurp("profile:zoovy:site_rootcat"); default(".");

	goto(label=>"SPECSTORE",ne=>".");

/* this is a root level category store, only the top level cat is needed to set in the recent_category_tier1 var */	
	load($PATH.TIER1);
	element(TYPE=>"SET",SRC=>"CART::RECENT_CATEGORY_TIER1",DATA=>$_);
	load($PATH.TIER2); default("");
	goto(label=>"SETTIER2TOBLANK",eq=>"");
		load($PATH.TIER1); format(posttext=>".");
		format(posttext=>$PATH.TIER2);
		element(TYPE=>"SET",SRC=>"CART::RECENT_CATEGORY_TIER2",DATA=>$_);
		stop();
	
/* this is a specialty store. set recent_category_tier1 to two tiers deep. This is a 'most cases' solution */
:SPECSTORE();
	load($PATH.TIER1); format(posttext=>".");
	format(posttext=>$PATH.TIER2);
	element(TYPE=>"SET",SRC=>"CART::RECENT_CATEGORY_TIER1",DATA=>$_);
	
	load($PATH.TIER3); default("");
	goto(label=>"SETTIER2TOBLANK",eq=>"");
		load($PATH.TIER1); format(posttext=>".");
		format(posttext=>$PATH.TIER2);
		format(posttext=>".");
		format(posttext=>$PATH.TIER3);
		element(TYPE=>"SET",SRC=>"CART::RECENT_CATEGORY_TIER2",DATA=>$_);
		stop();		
	

:SETTIER2TOBLANK();
	element(TYPE=>"SET",SRC=>"CART::RECENT_CATEGORY_TIER2",DATA=>"");
%>

Subcategories

      "); :LOOP(); pop(stack=>>$CATSTACK,namespace=>"CAT"); load($CAT.safe); stop(unless=>$_); print("
    • "entity"); print(); print("">"); print($CAT.pretty); print("
      • "); /* keep looping till we have shown all the subcats */ goto(nb=>$CATSTACK,label=>"LOOP"); print("
    "); :END(); %>
ELEMENT.INIT:
<%
/* set src to the most recent tier 1 so that tier 2 (and maybe a tier 3) will display */
loadurp("CART::RECENT_CATEGORY_TIER1"); default($SRC); initset(SRC=>$_);
%>

ELEMENT.HELPER: Sets the category path for use in the breadcrumb element. Only gets skipped on product pages, that way hitting the home or results pages resets the path.

ELEMENT.HTML: Home » <% load($cat_pretty); default(""); print(); %>
ELEMENT.INIT:
<%
/* override the default INI values here. this gets preprocessed.  */
loadurp("CART::RECENT_CATEGORY_PATH"); default($PATH); initset(PATH=>$_);
%>

ELEMENT.PROMPT: Banner: top next to menu and minicart (180 x 30)

ELEMENT.HELPER: Add up to eight wiki based links that will appear in the customer service section of the footer. A finite amount of space is allocated for each link and adding more text than what is allowed will result in cropping (text being cut off). HTML is not allowed. Each link will automatically be put on it's own line.
